tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: Weekend Breakfast
programme.desc: Ease into your Sunday as Fauziah Ibrahim and Thomas Oriti bring you an engaging mix of the latest news, information, analysis, interviews, politics, global affairs, culture and weather. Plus sport with Jared Coote.

programme.title: Offsiders
programme.desc: Abbey Gelmi and the panel Elise Kellond-Knight, Roy Masters and Daniel Cherny discuss the Womens ODI World Cup, Sam Kerrs return to the Matildas plus Rugby Leagues Ashes series.

programme.title: Compass
programme.sub-title: The Bishop Who Knew Too Much
programme.desc: When Greg Thompson was made the Bishop of Newcastle, he refused to turn a blind eye to institutional child abuse and cover-ups. For him it was personal. Presented by Julia Baird.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Spring: Grand Country Garden and Urban Design
programme.desc: Tammy explores a visionary country garden in full bloom, Sophie shares shade plant tips, Jane visits a garden rich in horticultural history, Josh discovers a biodiverse verge, and we meet a world-renowned landscape designer.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Two incredible searches: a former Scotland footballer who searches for his mother after suffering a life-threatening brain tumour, and a woman pained with emotion on her wedding day because her birth mother was missing.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Following a cancer diagnosis, Gary and Lorilie set out to build a multi-million dollar multigenerational family home.

programme.title: My Brother Jack
programme.desc: David Meredith looks up to his brother, Jack, who stands up to their father who has become abusive after returning home from the war.

programme.title: The Art Of Food
programme.desc: Guest host Matt Preston wonders Can food be art? For answers, he meets chocolatier Kirsten Tibballs, chef Ben Shewry, glass artist Jenni Kemarre Martiniello and ventures to Indonesia to see an ancient cave painting.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Annika
programme.desc: When a phone with a brutal drowning recorded on it is handed in to MHU headquarters, the pressure is on for Annika and the team to track down the murderer.

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: Parliament resumes for a new sitting fortnight. Coverage of Question Time from the Senate.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Two stories of sisters kept, while their brothers were given up for adoption.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: Four Corners
programme.desc: Despite government promises of reform, Adele Ferguson uncovers more than 100 cases of alleged paedophiles who worked or are working in child care, enabled by systemic failures, weak oversight and a profit-driven industry.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Donald Trump on the world stage meeting with ASEAN leaders including Anthony Albanese in Malaysia, then on to Japan and South Korea. Meanwhile at home the government shutdown, and the East Wing of the White House demolished.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the story with the latest on the days events, explaining whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe uncovering what you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow.

programme.title: Creative Types With Virginia Trioli
programme.desc: Shes queen of TV and a celebrated theatre actor, but when Marta Dusseldorp moved her life and family to Tasmania she didnt exit the stage - she stepped up and became a producer for whom place and community is paramount.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.desc: The gang meet George Takei in a haunted Hollywood mansion.

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Beth and Leshawna try to one-up each other with fake injuries as they compete for the attention and sympathy of the other kids at daycare.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Perplexing Painting
programme.desc: When Esthers painting is damaged during the Art Show, Maudie has trouble proving who ruined the artwork without finding the evidence first.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Inaya takes Nash for a ride in her new ship.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: While preparing for bed, the Farmer manages to lock himself out of the house and is stuck outside in his pyjamas. He decides to spend the night in the barn but his incessant snoring drives the flock mad.

programme.title: Crongton
programme.desc: Liccle Bit keeps Mos return secret. After a sports day mishap, he delivers the package.

programme.title: Abbott Elementary
programme.desc: Janine is thrilled to help introduce a new beverage to the cafeteria.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Zoo
programme.desc: A hidden camera captures the birth of a litter of wolves, and a tortoise baffles the vets with a mysterious illness.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: Can you tell the difference between real and AI-generated videos? We put high schoolers to the test.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: The Horrible History of (sometimes literally) dressing to kill. Henry VIII has beef over whose armour is best, Louis XV dresses as a hedge, plus Viking Eye for the Saxon Guy.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: This episode tells the tale of where the baby Bears once lived. After a run-in with a video crew shooting a Sarah McLachlan-type animal adoption video, they almost seized an opportunity to find homes apart.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Concert Catastrophe
programme.desc: Maudie is crushed when her tickets to a pop concert go missing, especially since it seems likely that she herself has misplaced them.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Yoda joins Nubs on a mission to protect an old lightsaber.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: A wildlife film inspires Pidsley the cat to play a prank on the flock by disguising himself as a leopard. Shaun is convinced there is a huge beast on the loose and concocts a plan to catch it.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: How are bogies made? With the help of a supersized nose, the doctors make their own! We follow Dr Ronx on a busy hospital shift and Gladiator Dynamite kicks off a foot Body Battle!

programme.title: Gladiators UK
programme.desc: Legends legs get him into trouble on the Collision Bridge, and Fury gets ferocious in The Ring. Hold tight for the comeback of the series so far.

programme.title: rage Not For Broadcast Special
programme.desc: From M.I.A. to Madonna, N.W.A., Queen, The Kinks and more, rage lines up the best music videos that were banned on television when they first came out.

programme.title: Jonestown: Terror In The Jungle
programme.desc: Sadistic preacher Jim Jones forms The Peoples Temple after an unusual childhood. Members are captivated; his lust for power becomes unstoppable.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Its superhero time as the Doctors alter-egos go into battle to show the secret powers of your skin, which uses Vitamin D from the sun to make your bones strong!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: An artificial intelligence takes over a tech company.

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: The Bajau Laut people are sea nomads living in the South China Sea, and theyre hiding a secret. When Ant and Fontaine discover the secret, theyre determined to help them. But how do you find a fish that walks?

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: Creating some Clones to help with his long list of commitments, Pierce must confront his weakness for people-pleasing, and learn how to set some boundaries.

programme.title: Heartbreak High
programme.desc: Its exam time, and the pressure on students is building.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.sub-title: Blown Away / Brown Note / Chinese Water Torture
programme.desc: Can you really be blown away from a bullet? Adam searches high and low for the elusive bowel-loosening tone and, is water torture real?

programme.title: Louis Therouxs Forbidden America
programme.desc: Louis Theroux immerses himself in Floridas multimillion-dollar rap scene - as notorious for its controversy as its creativity.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Kayson formally charges Lewis with negligence in the death of a patient. A customs agent brings in a suspect whose intestines are packed with contraband. Benton is called out of surgery to find his senile mother.

programme.title: Rage New Music
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: Louis Theroux Interviews Rita Ora
programme.desc: Louis meets Rita at her dads pub in West London, where they sit down for a revealing conversation that takes in her rise to stardom and her familys arrival in the UK after fleeing Kosovo in 1990. (Final)

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors reveal how much power there is in your farts; Dr Chris trains as a nurse on a ward full of robotic patients; and in Ouch and About Dr Xand opens up the brand new drop-in clinic, the Ouch-Mobile.

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Ant and Fontaine rescue a Polar Bear from the middle of the ocean. When they bring it on board, they realise shes close to giving birth! Can the Nektons move her to a safer place in time?

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: Grizz, Panda and Ice Bear receive a special box and discover its magical ability.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Robin challenges the gang not to use their powers.

programme.title: Pokemon: Diamond And Pearl
programme.desc: The quarterfinal round of the Sinnoh League has arrived - and Ash and Paul are ready to face off in a rematch of their 6-on-6 full battle!

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: When the mysterious masked villain, "The Shadow," takes over the Mobile Unit vans computer, the team must act fast to regain control of the van before it drives into The Lake of Goo.

programme.title: Our Animals
programme.desc: Echidnas are small and shy animals that like to hide under bushes and in burrows. Learn about how echidnas find food, protect themselves from predators, find mates and look after their babies.

programme.title: Know It Alls: Science
programme.desc: Comedian Mark Humphries and Mariam take flight across the gallery of Australian Birds at the Australian Museum. Who will end up at the top of the pecking order?

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Adam and Jamie go head-to-head in a jail break race using salsa and, can you remove cement build up from a cement mixers barrel, using dynamite?

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.desc: Featured magicians include Jaana Felicitas and Nikolai Striebel, Evan Northrup, Marc Weide and Vincent.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Colly Wobble has lost her shoes and Moon Baby shows Colly Wobble the magical shoe tree, with different shoes growing on it. Colly Wobble tries the Wellington Boots. What a lot of splishy-sploshy fun!

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: Its snowing in Mollyvale sending everyone inside. Everyone except Russell. Soon, a chilly new chum, Freezy appears, and they become best friends. When Freezy has to leave, Beep and Mort make a special keepsake.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Bop has a lot of things to fix, but today he decides to make things even better than they were before.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector and Mole look for buried treasure, with surprising results.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Coco is staying at Bings house for her first sleepover and as she produces her collection of Rainbow Fairy Mice and insists on playing the Goodnight Game its not long before the differences in their bedtime routines emerge.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The grass is very long. It is so long that when Peppa and George play outside they cant see each other and lose their ball. The grass is too much for Daddy Pigs rusty old lawnmower so he calls Grandpa Pig for help.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: A film crew arrives to record a rare bird nesting at Mossybottom Farm. The Farmer is delighted by all the attention, but when a cameraman films the Flock enjoying a game of cricket, drastic action is needed.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea tricks Supertato and the Veggies, who fall into the deli counter and come face to face with the Turnip of Terror. They escape with help from the not-so-scary Turnip.

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: Isadora and Mirabelle go to dragon camp where Isadora rides Dashing Dazzle, the lively one!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: The Super Monsters Halloween party teaches Spike to persevere and shows the team how to turn messy mistakes into a fun, magical night for neighbors and friends.

programme.title: Mecha Builders
programme.desc: The Martians help Lloyd deliver packages, but the Mechas see they keep breaking when dropped from up high.

programme.title: Peppa Pig: Peppas Pumpkin Party
programme.desc: Daddy Pig is throwing a special party. Everyone is invited, and they are all coming dressed in scary costumes. Peppa is a witch, George is a dinosaur, Rebecca Rabbit is a carrot...gone bad!

programme.title: Maddie + Triggs
programme.desc: While playing in the garden Maddie + Triggs make a new friend named Reginald, and soon discover that crunchy leaves mean much more to this tiny little caterpillar.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Odd Sock Theo needs help to save some snails, because Gloria Greedi wants to build a car park space on their home. Andy and the Band come out of their shell to save the day.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Can water travel using a piece of string? Absorb some fun facts as Michelle strings together some household items to experiment with water.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: Realizing Mom could use a break from work, Millie and her friends put together their very own spa in the backyard.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: The Dream Factory Crew, Carlos and his pet cockatiel, Leon, make new friends when another cockatiel flies into the Dream Factory and their adventures begin.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Beluga Whales
programme.desc: When the Octonauts discover a pod of Beluga Whales stranded at a breathing hole, they use music to lead them to safety.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels quiet time with Duggee is interrupted when King Tiger arrives at the door with a magic hat on, instead of his crown! He learns that whichever makes him feel the most himself is the most important hat of all.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Rajiv learns that he can be really useful with or without his crown.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.sub-title: The Weight Of The World Depends On Orla
programme.desc: Orla shares the story of how she was chosen to protect the 44-leaf clover in order to stop the villain, Jellybean Joe, from causing oddness to the Mobile Unit van.

programme.title: Little J And Big Cuz
programme.desc: Take home readers - best day ever for Little J, and worst day ever for Levi!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: After smelling Granny Pigs perfume de lavender, Peppa experiments with the flowers in the garden to create her own special smell.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bored of the local playground, Dad and the kids go bush on a journey to their local creek. Cast out of her comfort zone, Blueys eyes are opened to the beauty of the natural world.

programme.title: Steve and Aneeshwar Go Wild
programme.desc: Steve and Aneeshwar meet some Asian elephants and give them a shower with a giant hose. They then meet some lemurs and discover their wild connection with the elephants.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: When balloons arrive in Storyland, Mr Onion cant choose his favourite. When the balloons carry Mr Onion up into the air, Little Nana finds a way to make sure everybody gets their favourite balloon - including Mr Onion!

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: Uncle Joe tells the kids about the best day of his life when he raced his famous billy cart, The Lightning Bolt. Determined to help him relive his glory, Beep and Mort rebuild the old cart so he can race it once more!

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Zap and Bop are best friends and decide to celebrate with a special day - but Best Friends Day does not go as well as expected.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: When the Sound Collector hears a whistle, hes surprised to find out where it comes from!

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Sula have a penny each for the Surprise Machine in Padgets shop. Sula gets the silver rhino she wanted so Bing is convinced he will get the toy he wants too.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are going to the dentist for a check-up. Peppa and Georges teeth are lovely and clean but Georges plastic toy "Mr Dinosaur" teeth are a bit yellow.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: An unusual guest lands on the Farm. When Shaun and Bitzer realise its hungry, they set about trying to find it some food - if only they could get their hands on the Farmers prize catch!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Trevor leads a group hike to the beaver dam and Pontypandy Mountain, but without using a compassand soon without a map, either!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: King Thistle takes up bird watching. Using his magic bird book, he spots a Woodpecker taking up residence in the Great Elf Tree. The King is keen for more birds, so is pleased when another makes a nest in the Royal Castle.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George have fun playing parachute games at playgroup with all their friends.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets buddy up for their first underwater orienteering adventure, ticking off sea creatures in an epic game of ocean bingo along the way.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: The Super Monsters show teamwork makes the impossible possible by growing a magical seed together.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Telephone Bird
programme.desc: Jay thinks they have discovered a new bird, the Telephone Bird! Nikhil wants to make it real for his brother and feeds his imagination as he helps him to find it.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: When the Sound Collector takes his boat on the stream, its hard to keep on playing!

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Why do our bodies make snot when were sick? Poor Big Ted has the flu and is all sneezy and snotty. Dr Karl shows Matt how you can make your own snot without being sick!

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Join The Wiggles and sing along with the classic nursery rhyme Five Finger Family, then its off to visit the Wiggle Town Dancing Water Police to solve the mystery of the missing ballet shoe.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: A frog on a dog on a hog on a log helps the Alphablocks cross the bog to get their missing cog. This episode has fun with the words hill, net, bog, cog, frog, hop, dog, dig, hog, jig, log, jog and box.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: After smelling Granny Pigs perfume de lavender, Peppa experiments with the flowers in the garden to create her own special smell.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: After accidentally ruining the magic of Bens trick, Millie sets out to help him perform the most magnificent disappearing trick ever!

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: The Dream Factory Crew turn a pile of boxes into an amazing pretend-play medieval castle, but when Biff and Tiff lay siege, Moose and Fluffles wind up in peril from a modern-day "dragon."

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Vampire Squid
programme.desc: Peso must gather all his courage when he travels deep down to the very bottom of the ocean, the Midnight Zone, and encounters the mysterious Vampire Squid!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels are having fun playing games but are surprised to find out that Betty didnt always enjoy playing.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Gordon becomes very worried when he gets a serious case of the giggles.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy and the kids create mini succulent cities from succulents and cacti complete with lights, little cars, dinosaurs and waterslides.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Learn some safety tips with The Wiggles in this fun and essential guide! From electricity, to scissors, to allergies, to tidying up - theres a bit of everything to help learn about playing and living safely.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Dracs confidence in his flying leads to trouble during a race at the obstacle course, but his friends use their superpowers to save him, teaching him that teamwork and humility are just as important as talent.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Goldie the Goldfish is feeling a little lonely, so Peppa takes her to the aquarium. With all the different fish surely Peppa can find a new friend for Goldie?

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.sub-title: Return to Planet Gloop Part II
programme.desc: Romeo betrays Gloop the Third and steals his planet.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.sub-title: Paddington Plays The Floor Is Lava
programme.desc: The Browns take part in a very competitive game of The Floor is Lava but who will win and will they make a good impression on an important visitor?

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: A young witch is planning on moving into Mrs Witchs house. Mrs Witch has to come out of retirement to keep her place in the Little Kingdom.

programme.title: Rocket Club
programme.desc: Rocket Club races to save a village of Purpguins (purple alien penguins) after Calvins failed WUP test leads to a meltdown of Planet Freezeball!

programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.desc: Shes queen of TV and a celebrated theatre actor, but when Marta Dusseldorp moved her life and family to Tasmania she didnt exit the stage - she stepped up and became a producer for whom place and community is paramount.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Record temperatures as extreme weather sets in across parts of the country, going against the guidelines - the rise in popularity of raw milk, plus a burning ball of space junk crashes to earth in the Aussie outback.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Yvonne Yong looks back at the week in news from Asia including: South Korea targets Cambodias scam industry after student death, a cargo plane crashes at Hong Kong airport, plus people across the globe celebrate Diwali.

programme.title: Planet America: Weekend Edition
programme.desc: Trump sends in a wrecking crew to demolish the East Wing of the White House. The racist group chat exposing what Young Republicans said when they thought nobody was listening plus Trumps $230 mil claim against the DOJ.

programme.title: National Press Club Address
programme.desc: Dr Daniel Timms, a biomedical engineer committed to developing cutting-edge cardiovascular medical devices including the total automatic heart (TAH) and advancing cardiac care, addresses the National Press Club.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: Start your morning with the latest headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories and the overnight news from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Record temperatures as extreme weather sets in across parts of the country, going against the guidelines - the rise in popularity of raw milk, plus a burning ball of space junk crashes to earth in the Aussie outback.

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers discusses the week in politics with Samantha Maiden, Tom Crowley and Matthew Knott including the PMs meeting with Trump, critical minerals, AUKUS, Kevin Rudd, environment policy plus the Nationals and Barnaby.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: ABC News With Auslan
programme.desc: The latest news and information from ABC News. This bulletin will be Auslan interpreted to provide accessible information to keep Australias deaf community connected and informed. Presented by Melissa Mackay.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: For the latest news as it happens ABC News is the home of breaking news, compelling stories and Australias best investigative journalism. Round the clock coverage of the news that matters to you from the team you can trust.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Meredith Sheehan brings you the latest headlines and a brief summary of the days top stories from ABC News.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and todays stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News Weekend
programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. We bring you todays events from reporters across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Live across Australia, the latest headlines and the days top stories from ABC News. We have reporters on the ground connecting communities, telling your stories and bringing you coverage of whats happening as it unfolds.

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: The great iron ore game, how BHP is countering Chinas push to reduce dependence on the West. Plus struggling to stay afloat, Healthscope sparks outrage with a plan to take employee tax breaks. Presented by Alicia Barry.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: A world-first mRNA vaccine for Foot-and-mouth disease; The champion horsewoman beating the health odds with the help of her horses; A new all-natural fabric combining wool with cotton; and the farmers turned publicans.

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers discusses the week in politics with Samantha Maiden, Tom Crowley and Matthew Knott including the PMs meeting with Trump, critical minerals, AUKUS, Kevin Rudd, environment policy plus the Nationals and Barnaby.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: DW Focus On Europe
programme.desc: After one year of protests against President Vucic, what keeps protesters in Serbia going? Plus how do children in Germany experience a parents cancer diagnosis, and where can they find support?

programme.title: Unusual Farmers
programme.desc: Pioneers dont just belong in centuries past. A dairy farming family in Queenslands Sunshine Coast hinterland is pioneering the farming of water buffalo to produce milk and meat.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: As each day begins get the facts you need to stay informed. Bridget Brennan and James Glenday present the latest news, overnight developments and todays top stories, joined by Emma Rebellato, Catherine Murphy and Nate Byrne.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Kathryn Robinson brings you todays top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter most.

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: Parliament resumes for a new sitting fortnight. Live coverage of Question Time from the House of Representatives.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days top stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Manny Tsigas.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Yvonne Yong presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Donald Trump on the world stage meeting with ASEAN leaders including Anthony Albanese in Malaysia, then on to Japan and South Korea. Meanwhile at home the government shutdown, and the East Wing of the White House demolished.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.
